oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dick Curless Interview - Biff Collie - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 2 of 2. Recording of an interview with Dick Curless (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dick Curless; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie asks Dick Curless if a train is on display -- (00:00) Curless talks about the train holding all his artifacts and how he uses it as a guest house -- (00:34) Curless talks about his reformation into a true studying Christian after surgery -- (02:00) Curless talks about the train being painted and talking with the painters about god -- (05:00) Curless compares the thought of a nice cup of gin to the filling feeling of the holy spirit -- (06:20) Curless talks about giving up drinking and the holy word -- (07:18) Collie and Curless discuss Curless' best friend who gave him his first guitar -- (08:32) Curless talks on his father's death and their interactions as adults -- (09:04) Curless depicts the three types of people that he likes -- (10:43) Collie and Curless reflect on Vaughn Horton and the tracks he and Curless worked on together -- (12:33) Curless reflects on the powerful lyrics of "Sgingin' Preacher" -- (12:59) Curless calls "Teardrops in My Heart" his favorite Vaughn Horton -- (13:15) Curless calls his favorite song to be the one in his heart on the given day -- (14:15) Collie and Curless discuss the most important person of Curless' country career being Jimmy Rogers -- (15:02) Curless talks about learning guitar through records of Josh White and misplaying rhythm -- (16:15) Curless tells of tale of walking five miles to get a Roy Acuff recording -- (16:46) Collie and Curless discuss how Curless wishes to see himself as a contributing man of god -- (17:40) Curless talks about wanting to remembered as an outlet of positivity -- (18:30) Collie discusses humor and Curless talks about tragic comedy -- (19:45) Curless talks about a small town in Montana where, in a bar, Curless saw the best fights of his life -- (21:10) Curless talks about an elder gentlemen who wanted to hear a Pearl Harbor song and joking with an Indian -- (22:08) Collie asks about bed time and Curless gives thanks and praise to god -- (23:25) Curless reflects on ending a show by displaying his message of redemption -- (24:47) Curless demonstrates his closing statements -- (25:03) Collie starts Curless on radio spots -- (25:17) Curless attempts radio spot addressing his audiobiography and Collie corrects him -- (25:32) Curless gives radio spot addressing his audiobiography -- (25:38) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (25:45) Curless gives radio spot addressing music and interview -- (25:50) Biff Collie radio spot directions (25:53) Curless gives radio spot addressing his audiobiography -- (25:58) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (26:02) Curless gives radio spot break for coming back to Nashville -- (26:06) (25:38) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (26:14) Curless gives radio spot addressing the break and his audiobiography -- (26:19) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (26:23) Curless radio spot addressing his audiobiography and Biff Collie -- (26:30) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (26:34) Curless gives radio spot addressing his audiobiography -- (26:38) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (26:44) Curless radio spot mistake and Collie correction -- (27:01) Curless radio spot mistake and Collie correction -- (27:18) Curless radio spot mistake and Collie correction -- (27:30 Curless says almost and Collie gives radio spot guidance -- (27:42) Curless radio spot addressing his audiobiography -- (27:46) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (27:50) Curless radio spot addressing Biff Collie -- (27:53) Collie jokes and gives Curless an option for next radio spot -- (28:10) Curless radio spot mistake and Collie suggestions -- (28:18) Curless radio spot about how Vaughn Horton influenced him -- (28:24) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (28:33) Curless gives radio spot addressing his audiobiography -- (28:38) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (28:45) Curless about Collie giving Curless opportunity to give life story -- (28:58) Curless gives radio spot addressing his audiobiography -- (29:03) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (29:07) Curless radio spot asking about the next portion of the show with Collie radio guidance -- (29:32) Curless radio spot saying "From the cradle of the Hit Parade and Back this is Dick Curless an Audiobiography" -- (29:38) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (29:40) Curless radio spot about Collie an audience -- (29:53) Curless tells the name of the program in radio spot -- (30:00) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (30:03) Curless radio spot mistake -- (30:11) Curless radio spot recap -- (30:18) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (30:24) Curless says goodbye radio spot-- (30:26) Biff Collie radio spot directions -- (30:30) Curless says goodnight
